item.name: name
item.desc: Name of the interaction. The name can be arbitrary but should be unique. For bonded interactions, this should match the name specified in the mapping file.

item.name: type1
item.desc: Only for non-bonded. **Bead** type 1 of non-bonded interaction.

item.name: type2
item.desc: Only for non-bonded. **Bead** type 2 of non-bonded interaction.

item.name: bondtype
item.desc: Internal alias for non-bonded and bonded, set automatically

item.name: min
item.desc: lower bound of interval for potential table in which calculations are performed. Should be set based on reference distributions.

item.name: max
item.desc: upper bound of interval for potential table in which calculations are performed. Should be set based on reference distributions.

item.name: step
item.desc: step size of interval for potential table in which calculations are performed. If step site is too small, lots of statistics is needed ( long runs ). If it's too big, features in the distribtuion/potentials might get lost.

item.name: inverse
item.desc: Contains all information relevant to iterative process

item.name: inverse.target
item.desc: target distribution (e.g. rdf) which is tried to match during iterations to match

item.name: inverse.do_potential
item.desc: Update cycle for the potential update. 1 means update, 0 don't update. 1 1 0 means update 2 iterations, then don't update, then repeat.

item.name: inverse.post_update
item.desc: Additional post-processing of dU before added to potential. This is a list of scripts separated by spaces which are called. See section on iterative framework for details.

item.name: inverse.post_add
item.desc: Additional post processing of U after dU added to potential. This is a list of scripts separated by spaces which are called. See section on iterative framework for details.

item.name: inverse.post_add_options
item.desc: Contains all options of post add scripts

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.overwrite
item.desc: Contains all options of the overwrite postadd scripts

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.overwrite.do
item.desc: pattern for overwrite postadd script (1 do, 0 do not).

item.name: inverse.p_target
item.desc: partial pressure of this species

item.name: inverse.particle_dens
item.desc: particle density of this species (for wjk pressure correction)

item.name: inverse.post_update_options
item.desc: Contains all options of post update scripts

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure
item.desc: Contains all options of the pressure correction scripts

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.do
item.desc: pattern for pressure correction (1 do, 0 do not). To do pressure correction every third step specify "0 0 1", similar to inverse.do_update

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.type
item.desc: Pressure correction algoritm, can be simple or wjk

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.simple
item.desc: Contains all options of the simple pressure correction script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.simple.scale
item.desc: slope of the simple pressure correction

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.wjk
item.desc: Contains all options of the wjk pressure correction script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.pressure.wjk.scale
item.desc: extra scaling factor of pressure correction

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.smooth
item.desc: Contains all options of the smooth script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.smooth.iterations
item.desc: number of iterations for triangular smooth

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.splinesmooth
item.desc: Contains all options of the spline smooth script

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.splinesmooth.step
item.desc: grid spacing for spline fit when doing spline smoothing

item.name: inverse.post_update_options.scale
item.desc: scale factor for the update

item.name: inverse.post_add_options
item.desc: This section contains all options for post add scripts.

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.copyback.filelist
item.desc: list of files to copy to the main dir

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.convergence.weight
item.desc: weight factors for the convergence of the interaction, should be a list of same length as inverse.post_add_options.convergence.what (default 1)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.convergence.what
item.desc: list for what to calc the convergence: dist pot, .. (default dist)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.gnuplot_bin
item.desc: gnuplot binary to use (default gnuplot)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.gnuplot_opts
item.desc: extra options to give to gnuplot_bin (e.g. -persist, if one uses kill)

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.fd
item.desc: file descriptor to use (default 8), make it unique if you want to plot multiple things

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.script
item.desc: plot script to give to gnuplot

item.name: inverse.post_add_options.plot.kill
item.desc: kill all processes with that name before ploting (e.g. gnuplot_x11), this is more reliable than using multiplot

item.name: inverse.imc
item.desc: Section containing inverse monte carlo specific options.

item.name: inverse.imc.group
item.desc: Group of interaction. Cross-correlations of all members of a group are taken into account for calculating the update. If no cross correlations should be calculated, interactions have to be put into different groups.

item.name: inverse.gromacs
item.desc: This section contains gromacs specific options in case gromacs is used as simulation program.

item.name: inverse.gromacs.table
item.desc: Name of file for tabulated potential of this interaction. This fill will be created from the internal tabulated potential format for every run.

item.name: inverse.gromacs.grp1
item.desc: Name of energy group of bead type1 using in the g_rdf index file.

item.name: inverse.gromacs.grp2
item.desc: Name of energy group of bead type2 using in the g_rdf index file.

item.name: inverse.espresso
item.desc: This section contains espresso specific options in case espresso is used as simulation program.

item.name: inverse.espresso.table
item.desc: Name of file for tabulated potential of this interaction. This file will be created from the internal tabulated potential format for every run. Note, though, that the original espresso blockfile needs to contain the name of that table as the tabulated interaction (see tutorial methanol ibi_espresso for details).

item.name: inverse.espresso.index1
item.desc: Index list of type1 -- Name of the Tcl variable containing all index1 particles that is contained in the espresso blockfile.

item.name: inverse.espresso.index2
item.desc: Index list of type2 -- Name of the Tcl variable containing all index2 particles that is contained in the espresso blockfile.

item.name: fmatch
item.desc: Force matching options

item.name: fmatch.min
item.desc: Minimum value of interval for distribution sampled in atomistic MD simulation. One can get this number by looking at the distribution function for this interaction. For non-bonded interactions it's the distance to the rdf start. For CG bonds and angles the variable has the similar meaning ( note, that for angles it is specified in radians ).

item.name: fmatch.max
item.desc: Maximum value of interval for distribution sampled in atomistic MD simulation. One can get this number by looking at the distribution function for this interaction. For non-bonded interactions it's the cut-off of the interaction.

item.name: fmatch.step
item.desc: grid spacing for the spline, which represents the interaction. This parameter should not be too big, otherwise you might lose some features of the interaction potential, and not too small either, otherwise you will have unsampled bins which result in an ill-defined equation system and NaNs in the output.

item.name: fmatch.out_step
item.desc: Grid spacing for the output grid. Normally, one wants to have this parameter smaller than fmatch.step, to have a smooth curve, without additional spline interpolation. As a rule of thumb we normally use fmatch.out_step which is approximately 5 times smaller than fmatch.step.

item.name: tf
item.desc: Contains all information relevant to thermoforce iteration

item.name: tf.spline_start
item.desc: Start of the spline used to smooth the density

item.name: tf.spline_end
item.desc: End of the spline used to smooth the density

item.name: tf.spline_step
item.desc: Grid of the spline used to smooth the density

item.name: tf.molname
item.desc: Molecule name of this gropu used in gromacs topology

item.name: tf.prefactor
item.desc: Prefactor for the thermoforce (f=-prefactor * grad density)

item.name: tf.cg_prefactor
item.desc: Second Prefactor for the thermoforce will be linear interpolated with tf.prefactor
